author: Anonym
title: In a harsh phone call, Biden demanded that Netanyahu release Palestinian tax revenues - voila! news - The Limited Times
text:
Biden: I wish I could be there to hug Abigail/Reuters
US President Joe Biden had a difficult conversation with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu last Saturday about Palestinian tax revenues that Israel has been freezing for two months. Biden demanded that Netanyahu solve the problem and then ended the conversation, according to two senior American and Israeli officials and a third source familiar with the issue.
More on the subject: Israel to US: Demand Hezbollah 10 kilometers from border Poll: Nearly half of Israelis think Netanyahu is misbehaving vis-√†-vis Biden Biden: "Bibi told me, 'You dropped an atomic bomb, many civilians were killed.'" "Investing in this land now can make you a millionaire." Why it's important: A senior US official said it was one of the most difficult and frustrating phone calls between Biden and Netanyahu since the start of the war in Gaza. The difficult conversation is another sign of the growing tension between the president and the prime minister in recent weeks. More in Walla! Biden hugs and the shekel soars: Why is the currency strengthening during our most difficult times? See full article >
Quick reminder: Two months ago, Israel's political-security cabinet decided to deduct about 40 percent of the tax revenues Israel collects for the Palestinian Authority, which it is obligated to transfer to it by virtue of agreements between the sides. The decision was made following a demand by Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, who claimed that the funds were transferred by the PA to the Gaza Strip and would therefore reach Hamas. Since that decision, Smotrich has refused any compromise on the issue and even threatened that if the funds were transferred directly or indirectly to the Palestinian Authority, he would resign from his position. One of the most difficult and frustrating phone calls. Joe Biden and Benjamin Netanyahu/Government Press Office, Haim Tzach
Backstage: The 45-minute conversation focused on the next phase of Israel's ground operation in Gaza and plans to expand it to al-Bureij refugee camp in central Gaza, Israeli and U.S. officials said. Toward the end of the conversation, however, Biden raised his concerns about Israel's freezing of PA tax revenues. The president asked the prime minister to accept a proposal that Israel itself made to the United States a few weeks ago, according to which the offset tax lines would be transferred to custody in Norway until an agreement was reached that would address Israel's concern that the money might reach Hamas. The Palestinian Authority has already agreed to this proposal and made it clear to the US that under such an arrangement it would be willing to renew the receipt of the portion of tax money that Israel did not freeze. A senior U.S. official and a source familiar with the contents of the conversation said that Netanyahu surprised Biden by retracting Israel's agreement and said he no longer believed the Norwegian proposal was good. Netanyahu told Biden that he does not trust Norway and stressed that the Palestinian Authority should simply take part of the tax money that Israel is willing to transfer to it. Biden replied to Netanyahu that the U.S. trusts Norway and that should be enough for Israel to trust that offer as well, a senior U.S. official said. U.S. and Israeli officials said Biden told Netanyahu he had to deal with extremists in his coalition who oppose the transfer of tax dollars just as he faces political pressure on the Gaza war from some congressional Democrats. A few minutes later, Biden told Netanyahu that he expected him to find a solution to the issue, noting that "this conversation is over." "The feeling was that the president was going above and beyond for Netanyahu and taking political risks every day, but when Bibi's moment comes to give something back and take a political risk, he won't do it," a senior U.S. official said. Another senior U.S. official who commented on the details of the article tried to downplay the controversy, noting that Netanyahu did not reject the Norwegian proposal out of hand, but "said that he was still trying to resolve some issues on the Israeli side." Snapshot: A few days after the conversation between Biden and Netanyahu, a close associate of the prime minister, Minister Ron Dermer, arrived at the White House for talks with President Biden's national security adviser, Jake Sullivan. The issue of Palestinian tax money was one of the topics discussed. A senior US official noted that since the phone call between Biden and Netanyahu, progress has been made on the issue. "I think this matter is on the way to being resolved," the U.S. official said. What they say: A White House spokesman said the conversation between Biden and Netanyahu was "good and helpful." More on the subject: Benjamin Netanyahu Joe Biden Iron Sword War Gaza War Taxes Palestinians

author: CNN
title: Massive California waves injure some onlookers and bring flooding, treacherous beach conditions up the West coast
text:
Massive California waves injure some onlookers and bring flooding, treacherous beach conditions up the West coast
CNN, KION, KPIX, KGO, VENTURA PD AND THE CITY OF VENTURA, SANTA CRUZ COUNTY, CHP SANTA CRUZ
By Elizabeth Wolfe, Robert Shackelford and Cindy Von Quednow, CNN
(CNN) ‚Äî A powerful offshore storm is
driving towering waves into the California coastline, triggering flooding and warnings of dangerous and damaging swells after several people were injured by a wave along Ventura beach on Thursday.
The wave crashed over a barrier along the southern California beach, tossing a wall of fast-moving water at a group of onlookers who rushed to escape the deluge, witness video shows. Seawater quickly knocked some people off their feet and pummeled cars as drivers tried to speed away.
Nearly 20 people were briefly swept away in the incident and eight people were taken to the hospital, Ventura officials said.
High water and dangerous rip currents will churn along some of California‚Äôs beaches through the weekend as much of the West coast ‚Äì spanning from the US-Mexico border to southern Oregon ‚Äì is under coastal flood and high-surf alerts, the National Weather Service said.
Waves as high as telephone poles ‚Äì about 40 feet ‚Äì could slam into San Francisco through Friday morning. Fifteen to 20-foot waves are expected along the central coast.
The dangerous conditions pose an ‚Äúexceptional risk‚Äù of ocean drowning and damage to structures like piers and jetties, the National Weather Service said.
The spectacular waters have enthralled some surfers and onlookers, but weather officials are cautioning that the waves and strong rip tides can be perilous for those nearby.
‚ÄúLarge breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore,‚Äù the National Weather Service warned.
At least one fisherman fell overboard in a harbor off Oxnard and later came ashore uninjured, the Ventura County Fire Department said.
The conditions have already caused some road closures and evacuations in coastal California communities and prompted the rescue of five campers along the San Luis Obispo coast.
Crews in Ventura worked through the night to reinforce a mile-long sand barrier that was damaged by powerful waters on Thursday, the local fire department said. Standing about seven feet tall, the raised wall helps protect beachside communities.
Hoping to discourage spectators, local officials closed a main access point to Ventura Pier, which saw a swell of about 20 feet on Thursday. Some coastal streets in the area have also been closed as a precaution.
In central California‚Äôs Santa Cruz, the sheriff‚Äôs office
issued an evacuation warning for some areas on Thursday, which included areas of Rio Del Mar, where seawater filled beachside roadways and pushed against some homes, CNN affiliate KION reported. The warnings were lifted later in the day.
The most extreme impacts were expected along the central and Ventura County coasts, along with Hermosa, Manhattan and Palos Verdes beaches, the weather service in Los Angeles said Thursday.
Tempestuous waters are also battering Northern California, where the Bay Area could see waves of 28 to 33 feet, the weather service advised.
A high wind alert is also in effect for the Bay Area on Friday as wind gusts of up to 50 mph are expected.
Rainfall is likely to stretch northward from the Bay Area throughout the day Friday before shifting south into the weekend.
Massive waves attract surfers to Mavericks
Despite safety warnings, the massive waves are a welcome sight to surfers hungry to tackle the legendary swells at Mavericks Beach, about 25 miles south of San Francisco.
Pro surfers and spectators flocked to the beach on Thursday for a competition at the site known for having
some of the biggest waves in the world, CNN affiliate KGO reported.
Local resident Ion Banner
told the affiliate that surfers from Brazil, Tahiti and Hawaii were out in the water. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs pretty gnarly, it‚Äôs super big,‚Äù he said.
‚ÄúThe waves looked absolutely massive and it was everything that we expected,‚Äù said Miguel Blanco, who told KGO he flew in from Portugal to surf the waves. ‚ÄúIt was really big, I‚Äôd say 40-60 foot waves.‚Äù
Mavericks‚Äô jaw-dropping waves ‚Äì caused by unique underwater rock formations ‚Äì reach their biggest heights in the winter, when big wave surfers from all over the world make pilgrimages to face the swells.
The legendary waves and the surfers who brave them have been the subject of several films and documentaries, including the 2012 biopic ‚ÄúChasing Mavericks‚Äù about American surfer Jay Moriarity‚Äôs journey to surf Mavericks as a teen.
On Thursday, the conditions were prime for surfers like Blanco.
‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs your turn, you just gotta go,‚Äù Blanco said. ‚ÄúWhen you see a big wave, you‚Äôre kinda scared but at the same time you‚Äôre feeling like you should go and you just go and enjoy the ride.‚Äù
CNN‚Äôs David Williams contributed to this report.
The-CNN-Wire
‚Ñ¢ & ¬© 2023 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: Anson Wainwright
title: Jonathan Rodriguez‚Äôs promoter Paco Damian discusses weight issues prior to failed bout vs Kosei Tanaka
text: Jonathan Rodriguez‚Äôs promoter Paco Damian discusses weight issues prior to failed bout vs Kosei Tanaka Junior bantamweight contender Jonathan Rodriguez had been due to face Kosei Tanaka for the WBO 115-pound title on Saturday. However, at the weigh in the day before he tipped the scales at 121.25, meaning he was 6.25-pounds overweight and the fight was correctly soon scratched. It was hard not to feel sorry for Tanaka who had done his part and made weight, while Rodriguez has become something of a pariah, especially in Japanese circles. His promoter, Paco Damian, who is a disciple of the late great Hall of Fame promoter Don Chargin, had gone to Japan with high hopes only to leave with his tale between his legs after a particularly difficult few days. ‚ÄúThis situation was very embarrassing,‚Äù Damian told The Ring. ‚ÄúUnfortunately since Wednesday Jonathan started cramping, had trouble breathing, and felt pressure in his chest. I had no choice but to hydrate him and try to stay ahead of his symptoms. From that point we couldn‚Äôt catch up. ‚ÄúNo excuses on my end. I am the promoter and I assume all the responsibility. No finger-pointing to the fighter or trainer. I love our sport and one thing I can say is: There was never a bad intention on coming heavy. ‚ÄúWhen I spoke with Mr Honda about it, I spoke the truth. He is an honorable man with a lot of experience. I would like to believe he knows we never had a bad intention to come overweight or to use it as advantage. We kept trying until last minute to lose every little [bit of] weight we could. We absolutely did our best as a team to make the fight happen. Until medically it was not possible.‚Äù Rodriguez weight 121.6-pounds on the Wednesday of fight week but was unable to shift any additional weight due to the ailments. Ë©¶Âêà‰∏≠Ê≠¢„Åß„Åô Áõ∏ÊâãÈÅ∏Êâã„Åå2.9kg„Ç™„Éº„Éê„Éº ÂÜçË®àÈáè„ÇÇÊñ≠Âøµ„Åó„Å¶Ë®àÈáèÂ§±Ê†º Áõ∏ÊâãÈÅ∏Êâã„ÅÆ‰ΩìË™ø„ÇÑ Ë©¶Âêà‰∏çÊàêÁ´ã„Å´„Å™„Å£„ÅüÊà¶„ÅÑ„ÇíË°å„ÅÜ‰∫ãËá™‰Ωì„ÄÅÊú¨Êù•ËâØ„Åè„Å™„ÅÑ‰∫ã Ëâ≤„ÄÖ„Å™‰∫ã„ÇíË∏è„Åæ„Åà„Å¶ Ë©¶Âêà‰∏≠Ê≠¢„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜÂà§Êñ≠„Åß„Åô ÊòéÊó•„ÅØ„Ç∞„É≠„Éº„Éñ„Åß„ÅØ„Å™„Åè „Éû„Ç§„ÇØ„ÇíÊåÅ„Å£„Å¶ „É™„É≥„Ç∞„ÅßÁöÜ„Åï„Çì„Å´È°î„ÇíË¶ã„Åõ„Åæ„Åô ÊÆãÂøµ„Å™„ÅäÁü•„Çâ„ÅõË™†„Å´Áî≥„ÅóË®≥„Åî„Åñ„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ [pic.twitter.com/Eq3ehi74dy] ‚Äî Áî∞‰∏≠ÊÅíÊàê/KOsei Tanaka (@KOsei530) [July 19, 2024] Prior to that, everything according to Damian, things were going smoothly and just how they had planned. ‚ÄúEverything was on track,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI asked them their answer was every thing is going great.‚Äù Once it became obvious to Damian that things were veering off course he attempted to help. ‚ÄúI made some calls to the USA searching for advice,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI was concerned and I knew then we were in big trouble. We all had the hope that somehow by controlling the cramps we can keep working safely on losing the extra weight. ‚ÄúUnfortunately every time the cramps will come back all we worked and the weight he lost was in vain because I had to give him some liquids to keep him safe, that brought him right back to the weight he was. We couldn‚Äôt catchup. ‚ÄúOn Wednesday, when this happened, I didn‚Äôt point the finger at anybody, instead I try to keep everyone calm and deal with the situation. I took over, Every time we worked to lose weight, I pushed Jonathan to the limit responsibly. However, at the time I had a big responsibility and that was his health first.‚Äù The promoter is apologetic about what happened and more than willing to take his medicine. ‚ÄúThis hasn‚Äôt sat well with me,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI have never accepted excuses, excuses are for people that are not willing to assume responsibility. ‚ÄúOther athletes from different countries made weight just fine. The damage we have caused is unrepairable. As the lead person of my team I assume all the responsibility to be laid upon me.‚Äù It is of course very early in the process, but the JBC are notoriously tough on offenders. They had a no-nonsense approach to Luis Nery who tested positive for zilpaterol and flagrantly missed weight against Shinsuke Yamanaka, and was given a lifetime ban. That ban was subsequently rescinded to allow Nery to face Ring junior featherweight titleholder Naoya Inoue in May. Each case is different and judged on its own merit. ‚ÄúI am glad they are tough, as they should be,‚Äù he said, falling at their mercy. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know as of right now what their verdict will be.‚Äù Rodriguez‚Äôs short-term future depends on the JBC ruling, though he received some encouraging support from another sanctioning body. ‚ÄúI had a conversation with [WBC President] Mr. Mauricio Sulaiman while in Japan in regard to this unfortunate situation and he personally offered me his board of doctors and experts to look into what happened to find out what was the cause of this, and also to use this to be as awareness to other athletes. And in what weight category Jonathan will fight in the near future.‚Äù ‚ÄúI have to wait for the JBC decision,‚Äù explained Damian. ‚ÄúThen we will proceed accordingly.‚Äù Questions and/or comments can be sent to Anson at [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#27424b55464e4944484653674b4e514209444809524c).

author: prismamedia.com
title: Airbus : un A380 de Qantas a r\u00e9alis\u00e9 des dizaines de vols\u2026 avec un outil coinc\u00e9 dans le moteur
text: Voici une r√©v√©lation qui ne va sans doute pas vous rassurer si vous devez [prendre l‚Äôavion](https://www.capital.fr/conso/chez-ryanair-le-telephone-portable-est-obligatoire-pour-prendre-lavion-1503943)‚Ä¶ Un [Airbus A380](https://www.capital.fr/economie-politique/une-ancienne-piste-dediee-a-lairbus-a380-en-passe-detre-transformee-en-piste-cyclable-geante-1501996) de la compagnie a√©rienne australienne [Qantas](https://www.capital.fr/economie-politique/un-boeing-737-de-qantas-oblige-de-se-poser-juste-apres-le-decollage-a-cause-d-un-probleme-moteur-1505224) a effectu√© des dizaines de vols avec un outil coinc√© dans le moteur, rapporte [Air Journal](https://www.air-journal.fr/2024-11-15-un-a380-de-qantas-a-effectue-des-dizaines-de-vols-avec-un-outil-coince-dans-le-moteur-5259181.html), ce vendredi 15 novembre. Cette invraisemblable d√©couverte fait suite √† une enqu√™te du Bureau australien de la s√©curit√© des transports (ATSB) concernant des d√©bris d‚Äôobjets √©trangers impliquant un A380-800. L‚Äôappareil en question, en provenance de Sydney, a atterri √† l‚Äôa√©roport de Los Angeles le 2 f√©vrier 2024, apr√®s avoir vol√© pendant pr√®s de 300 heures (soit 17 allers-retours) avec un outil log√© dans l‚Äôun de ses quatre moteurs Rolls-Royce. Lors de l‚Äôinspection de l‚Äôappareil, un m√©canicien de la compagnie a√©rienne a d√©couvert un outil de 1,25 m de long coinc√© contre les aubes directrices de sortie basse pression de l‚Äôun des moteurs, pr√©cisent nos confr√®res. Selon l‚ÄôATSB, l‚Äôoutil a √©t√© laiss√© dans le moteur lors de son contr√¥le pr√©c√©dent √† Los Angeles, soit pr√®s de 26 jours avant qu‚Äôil ne soit finalement d√©tect√©. [Boeing de Lufthansa : 11 personnes bless√©es dans un avion en proie √† de grosses turbulences](https://www.capital.fr/economie-politique/boeing-de-lufthansa-11-personnes-blessees-dans-un-avion-en-proie-a-de-grosses-turbulences-1505400) Aucun dommage sur le moteur Dans son rapport, relay√© par Air Journal, l‚ÄôATSB a indiqu√© que bien que l‚Äôoutil ait √©t√© ¬´d√©form√© par un flux d‚Äôair √† haute √©nergie¬ª, aucun dommage n‚Äôa √©t√© observ√© sur le moteur lui-m√™me. ¬´L‚Äôenqu√™te de l‚ÄôATSB a r√©v√©l√© que les m√©caniciens de maintenance n‚Äôavaient pas remarqu√© que l‚Äôoutil avait √©t√© laiss√© dans le carter du compresseur basse pression du moteur lorsqu‚Äôils ont effectu√© des v√©rifications pour d√©tecter d‚Äô√©ventuels corps √©trangers √† la fin de la t√¢che d‚Äôinspection endoscopique¬ª, a pr√©cis√© Angus Mitchell, commissaire en chef de l‚ÄôATSB. Par ailleurs, ¬´les ing√©nieurs de maintenance n‚Äôont pas entam√© la proc√©dure de perte d‚Äôoutil une fois que l‚Äôoutil a √©t√© identifi√© comme manquant, et l‚Äôing√©nieur de certification a remis l‚Äôavion en service alors que l‚Äôoutil n‚Äô√©tait pas retrouv√©.¬ª ¬´Les d√©bris et les dommages caus√©s par des objets √©trangers peuvent constituer une menace importante pour l‚Äôexploitation s√ªre des avions, c‚Äôest pourquoi des r√©glementations, des proc√©dures et des formations sont en place pour limiter le risque de dommages caus√©s par des objets √©trangers, en particulier ceux introduits lors de la maintenance¬ª, conclut le rapport de l‚ÄôATSB. ¬´Nous prenons cela tr√®s au s√©rieux et bien qu‚Äôaucun dommage n‚Äôait √©t√© subi par le moteur, il est essentiel que les processus appropri√©s en cas de perte d‚Äôoutils soient suivis¬ª, a d√©clar√© un porte-parole de Qantas. ¬´Depuis cet √©v√©nement, nous avons √©mis une directive de s√©curit√© interne rappelant √† nos ing√©nieurs et aux membres de l‚Äô√©quipe du magasin d‚Äôoutils de respecter ces processus pour garantir que cela ne se reproduise plus¬ª, a-t-il assur√©.

author: @prensagrafica
title: El Salvador disminuye exportaci√≥n de energ√≠a a C.A. ante √©poca seca
text:
El Salvador disminuye exportaci√≥n de energ√≠a a C.A. ante √©poca seca
Lectura 3:00 min
Lectura 3:00 min
El Ente Operador Regional(EOR) muestra que en mayo el pa√≠s solo inyect√≥ 14,791 MWh, cuando su promedio entre enero y abril hab√≠a sido de 83,756 MWh. El presidente de CEL confirm√≥ la restricci√≥n.
El presidente de la Comisi√≥n Ejecutiva Hidroel√©ctrica del R√≠o Lempa (CEL) y tambi√©n director general de Energ√≠a, Hidrocarburos y Minas de El Salvador, Daniel √Ålvarez, afirm√≥ este jueves que El Salvador ha limitado las exportaciones de energ√≠a a la regi√≥n con el fin de cuidar el recurso h√≠drico, que ha disminuido a ra√≠z de la √©poca seca.
‚ÄúActualmente los niveles de los embalses se encuentran en condiciones √≥ptimas para la √©poca; es m√°s, hemos restringido las exportaciones de energ√≠a para cuidar el recurso y evitar situaciones criticas‚Äù, afirm√≥ el funcionario en la red social X.
Los datos del Ente Operador Regional (EOR) confirmaron una disminuci√≥n de las exportaciones de energ√≠a que realiza El Salvador a los dem√°s pa√≠ses de la regi√≥n.
En lo que va de mayo, el pa√≠s solo ha inyectado 14,791 megavatios hora (MWh) mientras que entre enero y abril, su promedio fue de 83,756 MWh y en marzo del a√±o pasado, a la misma fecha, hab√≠a inyectado 61,740 MWh. El Salvador exporta energ√≠a a trav√©s del Sistema de Interconexi√≥n El√©ctrica para Pa√≠ses de Am√©rica Central (SIEPAC).
En la regi√≥n, Guatemala, Honduras y Costa Rica han tenido que declarar emergencia el√©ctrica, programar cortes de energ√≠a y racionarla por ciertas horas debido a que la √©poca seca ha reducido su generaci√≥n de energ√≠a hidroel√©ctrica.
En Honduras, nada menos este jueves, el Centro Nacional de Despacho de la Empresa de Energ√≠a El√©ctrica (ENEE) se declar√≥ en estado de emergencia por 48 horas debido a la ola de calor y la prolongada sequ√≠a que ha afectado a este pa√≠s.
En El Salvador, el nivel de los embalses ha disminuido en las √∫ltimas semanas.
Seg√∫n datos de la Unidad de Transacciones (UT), el 8 de mayo, la Central Hidroel√©ctrica Cerr√≥n Grande (la mayor del pa√≠s) reportaba 233.38 metros sobre el nivel del mar (msnm) cuando el 10 de octubre de 2023, este era de 243.03.
De igual forma, la presa El Guajoyo ha reducido su nivel desde 426.95 msnm el 16 de noviembre de 2023 a 420.95 msnm el 8 de mayo.
Seg√∫n √Ålvarez, hay ‚Äúsuficientes recursos para generar, transmitir y distribuir energ√≠a el√©ctrica para m√°s de 2 millones de usuarios‚Äù.
Los datos de la UT muestran que a marzo, la generaci√≥n hidroel√©ctrica aport√≥ el 11.03% del total de la energ√≠a. Esta generaci√≥n es menor en 39.9% a la energ√≠a h√≠drica generada en marzo de 2023.
Otros recursos
√Ålvarez dijo que el pa√≠s mantiene su generaci√≥n h√≠drica, que tambi√©n se complementa con energ√≠a geot√©rmica, fotovolt√°ica y e√≥lica.
‚ÄúHemos asegurado que haya suministro para generar energ√≠a con gas natural y b√∫nker, en el caso sea necesario y como parte de un mayor respaldo al sistema el√©ctrico nacional‚Äù, afirm√≥.
Seg√∫n los datos de la UT, la generaci√≥n de energ√≠a con gas natural es la que m√°s ha aportado a la matriz energ√©tica en marzo, con una participaci√≥n de 33.64%.
Esta planta de generaci√≥n de energ√≠a privada represent√≥ una inversi√≥n de m√°s de $1,200 millones. El gas natural sigue siendo un derivado del petr√≥leo, pero se considera un combustible de transici√≥n hacia la descarbonizaci√≥n total.
Tags
[Precios de la energ√≠a](/precios-de-la-energia-t262293)
- Energ√≠a
- CEL
- UT

author: Scott Chasen
title: Mizzou basketball's Caleb Grill can be NCAA Tournament star | Wichita Eagle
text:
Sports
He might be March Madness‚Äô best shooter. His Mizzou teammates say he‚Äôs elite at this, too
By this point in the season, most everyone knows what Caleb Grill does best.
‚ÄúOf course he can shoot the leather off the ball,‚Äù says Missouri teammate Jacob Crews.
‚ÄúHe can get going quick,‚Äù adds Drake men‚Äôs basketball coach Ben McCollum, tasked with engineering a game plan to quiet Missouri‚Äôs sharpshooting sixth man. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs obviously fantastic.‚Äù
Despite missing five games with a neck injury, and starting only a single contest this season, Grill has made more 3s than anyone on his team ‚Äî by 25.
He‚Äôs shooting 40.5% from deep entering the NCAA Tournament, and his highlights include a barrage of 30- (and 40-) footers, contested looks and shots while on the move. One teammate called him ‚Äúarguably, probably the best shooter in college basketball.‚Äù
His teammates benefit from it. His opponents fear it.
But there‚Äôs another part of his game that tells a bigger story.
‚ÄúHe‚Äôs had a lot of dunks this season,‚Äù Tigers junior Aidan Shaw said. ‚ÄúIf you watch some film, you can see him ‚Äî we call it lurking.‚Äù
That word brought a smile, then a laugh, out of the 6-3 205-pound Grill.
Grill says it comes down to anticipation and film study. If you know what the opponent wants to do and put yourself in the right positions, they‚Äôll give the ball away on occasion.
Easy as that, right?
Shaw, Crews and others painted a much more involved picture.
‚ÄúHe might be the best defender on this team,‚Äù Crews insisted. ‚ÄúI know we‚Äôve got Ant (Robinson). But Caleb‚Äôs everywhere. He can guard any position. He knows every position. He knows every play. He knows where to put other guys while he‚Äôs in the middle of putting himself in position.‚Äù
Crews, in fact, said Grill has ‚Äúa different aura about him when it comes to situations‚Äù and that he‚Äôs never had a teammate so adept at film study. Shaw, attempting to explain how Grill ranks second on Missouri (22-11) in steals, went back to Grill‚Äôs high school days in Wichita.
‚ÄúSo, he used to play football, and he used to play quarterback,‚Äù Shaw said. ‚ÄúSo I would say that‚Äôs where he might get it from. But also having that kind of awareness where he‚Äôs seeing where people are passing the ball. He gets a lot of skip passes and intercepts them.‚Äù
Which leads to run-outs ... and dunks.
Funny enough, Grill has dunked 13 times this season (and missed twice), according to tracking data from Synergy. Josh Gray, a 7-footer who has played in 32 games for Missouri and started 16 at center, is 13-of-16 on dunks, including a Shaq-esque throwdown against Kentucky on senior day.
For a player who spends so much time camped behind the 3-point line, you might not expect Grill to score nearly a third of his 2-point baskets by dunking. Just like you might not expect Grill‚Äôs 45 steals, 1.6 per game, to rank second for the Tigers behind Robinson‚Äôs 64 (2 per contest).
‚ÄúHe studies this game. He loves this game. And it shows,‚Äù Crews said. ‚ÄúNothing is too small or big for him. Every role is important. That means if he‚Äôs having to be in help defense or man-to-man defense or zone defense, he always knows what he‚Äôs doing.‚Äù
That will be on display in a perfect setting.
While Grill wasn‚Äôt sure ‚Äî or didn‚Äôt want to divulge ‚Äî the exact number of tickets he‚Äôd set aside for family and friends, he said he was grateful for everyone who would be able to see him play his first competitive game in Wichita since his high school days at Maize.
He was a four-sport athlete there.
Grill, who said in an interview with Mizzou Athletics he has lived in Mulvane, Maize, Garden Plain and Wichita, has kept a level head about returning home. Several teammates, including graduate guard Tony Perkins, described Grill as being ‚Äújust his normal self.‚Äù
Part of that, Perkins added, is Grill‚Äôs excitement about returning to the NCAA Tournament in his sixth and final season of college. Particularly after missing most of last season ‚Äî as Mizzou went 0-18 in SEC play ‚Äî due to injury, then missing five more games this year with a scary neck injury that left him fearing his college career could be done.
‚ÄúHonestly,‚Äù Grill said back in February, ‚Äúsometimes I wish the games were longer.‚Äù
Grill has found joy the entire season in winning, helping the No. 6-seeded Tigers build an NCAA Tournament resume and taking teammates who have never been to the Big Dance to their first trip.
While he‚Äôll almost certainly come off the bench ‚Äî as you‚Äôd expect from the SEC‚Äôs sixth man of the year ‚Äî no one is shortchanging the effect he‚Äôll have on Thursday‚Äôs game (6:35 p.m. on truTV) against No. 11 seeded Drake (30-3).
Whether it‚Äôs his ‚Äúlurking,‚Äù dunking or, yes, logo 3-pointers at Intrust Bank Arena that get everyone going.
‚ÄúYou just try to limit it to one ...‚Äù McCollum said, ‚Äúand maybe he misses it.‚Äù

author: Anyka Pettigrew
title: Fortnite teases Nascar collab ahead of FNCS Global Championship - Dexerto
text:
Gaming
Fortnite Fortnite teases Nascar collab ahead of FNCS Global Championship Anyka Pettigrew ‚ùò Published: 2024-09-05T20:34:13 Epic Games/Dexerto The Fortnite Champion Series Global Championship begins the first weekend of September, and Epic Games has already indicated a Nascar collaboration is coming soon.
Held in Fort Worth, Texas on September 7-8, the FNCS Global Championship is an in-person tournament with a $200,000 prize for the winning team and a prize pool total of $2 million.
While most players have been swept up by the latest Chapter 5 Season 4 31.10 update , fans of Fortnite‚Äôs competitive side may be interested to know about an upcoming collab with one of the world‚Äôs most iconic auto racing organizations.
Article continues after ad Fortnite‚Äôs X account shared a post getting the audience hyped for the upcoming tournament, which also mentioned that Nascar was ‚Äúready to bring the energy‚Äù to it. This makes it sound like we‚Äôll get more information during the tournament.
A trusted Fortnite leaker presented more information in a quoted reply that revealed some important details about this long-awaited crossover.
Article continues after ad
NASCAR x Fortnite ü§î https://t.co/Mtd8SjYhpr pic.twitter.com/YbjIOWE3IG
‚Äî iFireMonkey (@iFireMonkey) September 5, 2024 According to the LinkedIn page of a Nascar employee, the company has plans to bring elements of the iconic brand into Fortnite through ‚Äúnew licensed Vehicles and new Rocket Racing Tracks.‚Äù
Article continues after ad That will likely mean new car skins for Rocket Racing, as well as Nascar cosmetics that you can use in the Battle Royale mode.
The leaked image provided also made it seem like Rocket League, also owned by Epic Games, will receive a similar Nascar collab.
This wouldn‚Äôt be the only time Fortnite has worked with companies to bring familiar cars to the Battle Royale mode. The Tesla Cybertruck arrived in the game just a few months ago.
Related: Fortnite Festival and Rocket Racing 23 January patch notes: New items, tracks & more Article continues after ad Players who love both franchises were ecstatic to hear about this news. In reply to another post talking about the Nascar crossover, someone said ‚Äúthat‚Äôs a crazy collab.‚Äù
Another commenter shared how hyped they were for this by simply telling Epic to ‚Äútake my money.‚Äù
Article continues after ad keep reading Fortnite Fortnite players slam Epic going for ‚Äúquick cash grab‚Äù after Cybertruck release Joe Pring Fortnite Fortnite leaks reveal potential Kingdom Hearts collab Michelle Cornelia Fortnite Fortnite leaks reveal new vehicle and unexpected collab Daniel Appleford Fortnite Fortnite Rocket Racing Season 1 Neon Rush patch notes: New tracks, cars, quest pack & more Josh Taylor Fortnite Fortnite Championship Series 2024 Majors: Schedule, streams, how to qualify & more Daniel Appleford Fortnite FNCS Global Championship 2024: Schedule, venue, prize pool & more Rishabh Sabarwal Fortnite Fortnite Rocket Racing 28.30 patch notes: Diestro car skin, Speed Run mode, more Josh Taylor Fortnite FNCS Global Championship 2023: List of all qualified participants Rishabh Sabarwal About The Author Anyka Pettigrew Anyka Pettigrew is a Games Writer on the US Dexerto team. She specializes in games such as Baldur's Gate, Diablo, and Valorant, amongst other games in genres such as RPGs, horror games, and farming sims. She was previously a writer for PC Invasion. You can contact her at: anyka.pettigrew@dexerto.com

author: Kelly Dudzik
title: National Public Safety Telecommunicators Week honors dispatchers | wgrz.com
text: BUFFALO, N.Y. ‚Äî This is National Public Safety Telecommunicators Week , a week to celebrate the 100,000 people who help keep us safe in 911 dispatch centers across the country. Joseph Sajdak started his career with the Erie County Sheriff's Office 25 years ago, and in that time he's seen a lot of things change, and he's helped a lot of people. "We work 12-hour shifts," Sajdak said. And throughout those shifts, Sajdak helped answer many of Erie County's 102,000 911 calls last year. "The day usually starts off slower and it gets crazier throughout the day," Sajdak said. Sajdak knew he wanted a career in law enforcement at an early age and decided he wanted to be a dispatcher after getting two degrees in law enforcement and taking the civil service test. He works the day shift. "Courts, medical runs, sending cars for service, school, SRO-related duties, and then in the afternoon is when everybody comes home to find problems. So those are more community-driven complaints where they come home, find their house broken into, something comes in the mail threatening information, calls on their phone," Sajdak said. He says when he started maybe about a quarter of the calls were from cell phones, and now only about 10 percent are from landlines. "The technology is evolving every day. We've gone from 911 calls to now taking text messages, and soon we'll be able to take video text messages and video calls," Sajdak said. A lot of the calls are serious, but he's has his share of, let's just say, interesting calls, too. "Naked people running down the street. We've had problems with people mowing each other's lawns. Those are the lighter aspects of weird calls, but some things are really strange and people do some really crazy things," Sajdak said. And his best career advice is that you have to be understanding both to the callers and the first responders. Sajdak says the training process takes anywhere from 12 to 16 weeks and some people pick it up pretty quickly. RELATED VIDEO:
